form.unit_system_tooltip: Changes display units for weight and temperature.

tooltips.ui_mode: Wizard mode is the most didactic and easy to use. Guided mode uses presets. Pro mode unlocks all sliders.

results.title: Dough Recipe
results.empty_state_desc: Adjust the parameters on the left to generate your perfect dough recipe.

calculator.name: Name
calculator.quantity_description: Define the amount of dough you need.
calculator.number_of_pieces_tooltip: How many units you are making.
calculator.weight_per_piece_tooltip: Individual weight of each dough ball.
calculator.total_flour_tooltip: The total amount of flour in the recipe.
calculator.total_flour_help: Used to scale the recipe based on flour.
calculator.style_section_description: Choose a base style to start your recipe.
calculator.dough_char_desc: Fine-tune hydration, salt, and yeast to control the texture and fermentation speed.
calculator.wizard_style_tip: Start with a classic style. You can customize everything later.
calculator.wizard_quantity_tip: You can define the total flour weight or the number of units.
calculator.wizard_dough_tip: Higher hydration makes softer dough but harder to handle.
calculator.wizard_env_tip: Tell us about your kitchen and oven for the best results.
calculator.wizard_welcome_desc: I'll guide you step-by-step to create the perfect dough. Just follow along, and I'll handle the complex calculations for you!

ingredients.water_content_tooltip: Water content relative to flour weight.
ingredients.salt_content_tooltip: Salt content relative to flour weight.
ingredients.controls_dough_wetness: Controls dough wetness and crust texture. Higher hydration (65%+) creates an open, airy crumb but is stickier to handle.
ingredients.regulates_yeast: Regulates yeast activity, strengthens gluten, and enhances flavor. 2-3% is standard for most styles.
ingredients.determines_fermentation: Determines fermentation speed. Adjust based on time and temperature. Less yeast = longer fermentation = more flavor.
ingredients.track_specific_starter: To track your specific starter hydration and feeding schedule, select {bold}.
ingredients.no_starters_found: No starters found in My Lab.

calculator.professional_tools_for_less_than_25_a_da: Professional tools for less than 25¢ a day.
calculator.no_starters_found_in_my_lab: No starters found in My Lab.
calculator.hydration_tooltip: Water content relative to flour weight.
calculator.usecalculator_must_be_used_within_a_calc: useCalculator must be used within a CalculatorProvider
calculator.failed_to_save_mode_to_localstorage: Failed to save mode to localStorage
calculator.custom_ingredients_footer: Custom ingredients allow you to track additional non-standard items (seeds, malt, etc.) in your formula.
calculator.preferments_not_typical_msg: Preferments like Poolish and Biga are not typically used with this style, but you can enable them in Advanced/Pro mode if desired.
calculator.dough_composition_desc: Ingredients mixed into the dough itself
calculator.dough_composition_desc_pizza: Core ingredients that form the pizza dough base
calculator.dough_composition_desc_bread: Ingredients incorporated into the bread dough
calculator.dough_composition_desc_pastry: Mix-ins and enrichments for your pastry dough
calculator.assembly_toppings_desc: Components added to the final product
calculator.assembly_toppings_desc_pizza: Sauces, cheeses, and toppings applied to the pizza
calculator.assembly_toppings_desc_bread: Fillings and toppings for your bread
calculator.assembly_lab_example_pastry: e.g., Chocolate chips, cream filling, glaze
calculator.choose_style_desc: Select a dough style to start with. Each style comes with preset parameters based on authentic recipes.
calculator.define_quantity_desc: Set the number of pizzas/loaves and their weight. This calculates the total flour needed.
calculator.customize_ing_desc: Adjust ingredients like flour type, yeast, salt, and water. Use Advanced mode for more control.
calculator.fermentation_strategy_desc: Choose how you want to ferment your dough (temperature, time, yeast amount).
calculator.baking_env_desc: Configure your oven settings and baking surface for optimal results.
calculator.save_preset_desc: Save your current configuration as a custom preset for future use (Pro Feature).
calculator.wz_texture_easy_desc: Easier to handle dough. Ideal for beginners. Results in crispier crusts.
calculator.wz_texture_balanced_desc: The sweet spot between ease and lightness. Airy and soft crusts.
calculator.wz_texture_airy_desc: Very wet and sticky dough. Requires technique, but produces incredible alveoli.
calculator.wz_time_fast_desc: Ready in 3-4 hours. Mild flavor, ideal for when you're in a rush.
calculator.wz_time_slow_desc: Rest in the fridge (Cold Ferment). Complex flavor and maximum digestibility.

styles.define_the_parameters_of_your_custom_dou: Define the parameters of your custom dough
styles.a_brief_appetizing_description_of_this_d: A brief, appetizing description of this dough style...
styles.try_adjusting_your_filters_or_search_ter: Try adjusting your filters or search terms.
styles.discover_professional_dough_specificatio: Discover professional dough specifications from around the world.
styles.parameters_verified_against_cereal_chemi: Parameters verified against cereal chemistry standards.
styles.flour_will_absorb_less_water_reduce_hydr: Flour will absorb less water. Reduce hydration by
styles.adjust_baking_metrics_for_your_specific_: Adjust baking metrics for your specific equipment.

dough_ingredients_desc: Structural components that form the dough base
dough_ingredients_simple: These are the basic things you mix together to make the dough
dough_ingredients_example: Think of it like making bread: flour + water + salt = dough!
assembly_components_simple: These are the yummy things you put ON TOP of your pizza or INSIDE your bread
assembly_components_example: Like cheese, tomato sauce, pepperoni - the toppings!
category_sauce_tooltip: ðŸ… Sauces: Liquids you spread on the dough (like tomato sauce or BBQ sauce)
category_topping_tooltip: ðŸ§€ Toppings: Things you put on top (like cheese, meat, vegetables)
category_filling_tooltip: ðŸ¥Ÿ Fillings: Things you put INSIDE (like in a calzone or pastry)
category_finish_tooltip: âœ¨ Finishes: Final touches added after baking (like olive oil or fresh herbs)
why_separate_explanation: Dough ingredients go IN the dough (you mix them). Assembly components go ON TOP or INSIDE (you add them later).
analogy_sandwich: Think of making a sandwich: Bread = Dough Ingredients. Cheese & Ham = Assembly Components!
analogy_cake: Like baking a cake: Cake batter = Dough Ingredients. Frosting & decorations = Assembly Components!
step_1_make_dough: Step 1: Make the dough (mix flour, water, salt)
step_2_let_rise: Step 2: Let it rise (wait for the dough to grow)
step_3_add_toppings: Step 3: Add toppings (put cheese, sauce, etc.)
step_4_bake: Step 4: Bake it (put in the oven)
tip_dough_first: ðŸ’¡ Always make the DOUGH first, then add TOPPINGS later!
tip_dont_mix: âš ï¸ Don't mix toppings into the dough - they go on top!
mistake_mixing_toppings: Some people try to mix cheese into the dough - that's not right! Cheese goes ON TOP after the dough is ready.
dough_goes_in: ðŸŒ¾ Dough Ingredients â†’ Mix INSIDE
toppings_go_on: ðŸ• Assembly Components â†’ Put ON TOP
remember_rule: If you MIX it = Dough Ingredient. If you PUT it on top = Assembly Component!
quantity_suggestion: We suggest {{amount}}g - but you can adjust to your taste!
gram_explanation: A gram is a tiny unit of weight. 100g is about the weight of a small apple ðŸŽ
before_baking_means: Before Baking = Add it, then put in the oven
after_baking_means: After Baking = Take out of oven first, then add it
during_baking_means: During Baking = Add it while it's cooking
validated_means: âœ… Validated = Traditional recipe, works great!
variation_means: ðŸ”„ Variation = A twist on the classic, still good!
experimental_means: ðŸ§ª Experimental = Creative idea, try it and see!
ai_simple_explanation: Our smart computer helper checks if your ingredients work well together and gives you tips!
standard_classification: Standard = Classic combination, used by many people
variation_classification: Variation = A little different, but still tasty
no_components_yet: You haven't added any toppings yet
start_by_adding: Start by clicking the buttons below to add ingredients!
recommended_means: These work really well with {{style}} style
try_these_first: Try these first - they're popular choices!
create_your_own: Want something different? Create your own!
browse_all: Or browse our library of 40+ ingredients
flour_hydration_too_low: Your hydration ({{currentHydration}}%) is below the recommended minimum of {{min}}% for this flour. The dough may be too stiff and difficult to work with.
flour_hydration_too_high: âš ï¸ Warning! Your hydration ({{currentHydration}}%) exceeds {{max}}% for this flour. Above this level, the dough may become too sticky and difficult to handle - it could turn into soup! Consider reducing hydration or using a stronger flour.
flour_hydration_optimal: Perfect! Your hydration is within the optimal range ({{min}}%-{{max}}%) for this flour.
flour_tip_beginner: ðŸ’¡ Beginner Tip: Start with lower hydration (around {{min}}%) until you're comfortable handling wetter doughs.
flour_tip_advanced: ðŸ’¡ Advanced Tip: This flour can handle up to {{max}}% hydration with proper technique and longer fermentation.
